alert.note: Alert for Fremont; Montgomery; Page (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 07 at 9:12PM CDT until May 07 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN FREMONT...SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY AND NORTHWESTERN PAGE COUNTIES... At 911 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles northwest of Corning to 3 miles north of Clarinda to 5 miles west of Blanchard, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. At 903 PM, quarter sized hail was reported 4 miles south of Stanton. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Shenandoah, Villisca, Essex, Farragut, Riverton, Coin, Yorktown, Northboro, Hepburn and Viking Lake State Park. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
